title: These American TikTok 'refugees' joined a Chinese app they knew nothing about
summary: With TikTok in danger of being banned in the US, many Americans have decided to migrate to an equivalent Chinese app, provoking some interesting conversations between young people on both sides of the Pacific.

title: Israel's Cabinet approves a deal for a ceasefire in Gaza and the release of dozens of hostages
summary: Netanyahu instructed a special task force to prepare to receive the hostages returning from Gaza and said their families were informed a deal had been reached.

title: Ex-CIA analyst pleads guilty of leaking docs on Israel plans to strike Iran
summary: According to a court filing, former CIA official Asif Rahman, on October 17, printed out two top secret documents, photographed the files and used a computer program to edit the images in 'an attempt to conceal their source and delete his activity.'

title: Abortion has been legal in France for 50 years. Yet a clause allowing doctors to decline to perform the procedure raises questions
summary: With every legislative change related to abortion, the clause stipulating that no healthcare provider 'is obliged to perform a voluntary termination of pregnancy' is questioned.

title: Far right restores Jean-Marie Le Pen's image without causing a stir
summary: The leaders of the Rassemblement National, who had feared a potential 're-demonization' of the party following the death of its co-founder, praised his career, encouraged by measured media coverage and political reactions.

title: David Lynch and the 'Twin Peaks' television revolution
summary: The filmmaker, who died on January 16, pushed the limits of what television could produce with a long-running whodunnit to find out who killed small-town high schooler Laura Palmer.

title: New York City mayor meets with Trump, Stallone
summary: A spokesperson for Eric Adams, who was indicted by a federal grand jury in September, said the mayor wanted to see Trump to 'discuss New Yorkers' priorities.' Adams added that he saw Sylvester Stallone during his visit with Trump and told the actor 'how much I love his "Rocky" series.'

title: How PM Bayrou managed to detach the Socialists from the left-wing coalition
summary: On Thursday, Parti Socialiste MPs decided to vote against the motion of no confidence submitted by their radical-left allies and supported by the Greens and the Communists. Socialist leader Olivier Faure nonetheless pledged to embody 'a left that makes the government yield.'

title: Julianne Moore, Almodóvar's new 'chica' in 'The Room Next Door'
summary: She has won the most prestigious awards and worked with the greatest filmmakers. At 64, the American actress has achieved a new pinnacle: starring in Pedro Almodóvar's first English-language feature film.

title: Russia sentences Navalny lawyers to years behind bars
summary: They were sentenced for bringing messages from the late opposition leader from prison to the outside world.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Behind the Israeli government's backward approval
summary: On Friday January 17, the Israeli security cabinet gave its approval to the proposed ceasefire in the Palestinian enclave, after almost two days of procrastination, marked by the recriminations of far-right ministers.

title: Macron announces aid conference to rebuild Lebanon
summary: The French president made the announcement as he visited Beirut in a show of support for Lebanon's new leaders.

title: Lobbying campaign against PFAS ban highlights opacity of European decision-making
summary: The investigation into 'forever chemicals' carried out by Le Monde and its partners reveals a lack of traceability in the exchanges between public authorities and PFAS manufacturers and users.

title: Senegalese authorities want to do away with French street names
summary: President Bassirou Diomaye Faye called for certain main roads bearing colonial names to be renamed in honor of 'national heroes.'

title: Supreme Court backs law banning TikTok if it's not sold by its Chinese parent company
summary: Donald Trump, mindful of TikTok’s popularity, and his own 14.7 million followers on the app, finds himself on the opposite side of the argument from prominent Senate Republicans who fault TikTok’s Chinese owner for not finding a buyer before now.

title: Musk backing for European far-right 'threatens democracy', says German Chancellor Scholz
summary: Olaf Scholz's comments come after the tech billionaire has been voicing his support on X for the far-right Alternative for Germany party.

title: How Eric Zemmour's small far-right party snagged seats to Trump's inauguration over the more powerful Rassemblement National
summary: Eric Zemmour and MEP Sarah Knafo of Reconquête! will be at the Capitol on January 20, a hard-won invitation. They will share the podium with the crème de la crème of the world's nationalist reactionaries.

title: Sweden's all-out tightening of migration policy
summary: As asylum and immigration figures continued to fall in 2024, the right and far right, in power since September 2022, have continued to make announcements aimed at tightening reception conditions in the Scandinavian kingdom.

title: Los Angeles's historic architecture goes up in flames
summary: The list of sites, buildings and architect's houses destroyed by fire is growing longer by the day, testifying to the disappearance of a precious heritage.

title: US accuses Walgreens of filling millions of illegitimate prescriptions, including for opioids
summary: Walgreens, which has over 8,000 locations across the country, said that it stands behind its pharmacists, stating they fill legitimate prescriptions for Food and Drug Administration-approved medications written by Drug Enforcement Administration-licensed prescribers in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.

title: In the West Bank, Mahmoud Abbas maneuvers to win over Donald Trump
summary: By deploying his forces against the armed groups in Jenin, the Palestinian president hopes to curry favor with the American billionaire, whose entourage includes many supporters of Jewish settlement in the West Bank.

title: When it comes to Donald Trump, Volodymyr Zelensky is all in
summary: The two political leaders got off to a bad start in 2019. Three years later, war broke out. With just a few days left until Trump's second inauguration, Le Monde looks back on a turbulent relationship.

title: TikTok could 'go dark' in US Sunday after Supreme Court ruling
summary: The US Supreme Court on Friday upheld a law supported by President Joe Biden and Congress that requires the app's owner ByteDance to either sell TikTok or cease US operations by January 19.

title: In Wuhan, the cab no longer has a driver
summary: More than 400 driverless vehicles are criss-crossing the central Chinese city on an unprecedented scale, enabling the country to gather kilometers of experience. Human cab drivers, meanwhile, are worried about their future.

title: Chinese diplomacy towards Syria's new regime hampered by presence of Uyghur fighters
summary: Uyghur fighters from the Turkistan Islamic Party helped Hayat Tahrir al-Sham overthrow the Bashar al-Assad regime, hindering Beijing's diplomatic support and economic aid.

title: UK: Following Elon Musk's accusations, the government announces a new audit into rape gangs
summary: The UK's interior minister, Yvette Cooper, announced on Thursday that a budget of nearly 6 million euros would be allocated to fund new local investigations into the scandal that has affected dozens of towns in central and northern England since 2000.

title: South Korea's president goes on trial as investigators seek to extend detention
summary: Impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol spoke for 40 minutes in court, in a hearing on whether to set him free, or extend his detention for around another 20 days. The court's ruling is expected late on Saturday or early Sunday.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Families of Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners await the first releases
summary: The Israeli government has formally approved the ceasefire agreement with Hamas, paving the way for the release of hostages held by the Islamist movement since the October 7 attack, in exchange for the freeing of Palestinian prisoners.

title: India: Court finds man guilty in infamous hospital rape and murder case
summary: After a trainee doctor was found raped and murdered in a hospital last year, nationwide protests and strikes rocked India. The trial was fast-tracked through the justice system, and a 33-year-old man was found guilty of the doctor's rape and murder.
